entry.title: how data captured in VBKD - BSTKD pass to delivery document in sap
entry.content:
In my client we have a requirement to capture the original order number while creating SAP sales order. 
Need suggestion for a Sales Order field which is equal or more than 20 CHAR and the value pass to delivery document as well as per standard.

entry.title: if we change a control code in existing material with revised tax code how it will impact
entry.content:
Hello All,

I want to change the control code from xyz to ABC in existing material, also need to change the tax rate for that material from 18%to 5% within date range 22.09.205 to 11.12.9999. How it will impact to the proforma invoices which is created before 22.09.2025. OR it is better to create a new material with new control code and revised tax rate.

 

Thanks and Regards

Vrushali

entry.title: regarding Backorder Processing (BOP)
entry.content:
Hi Experts!

I have a question regarding Backorder Processing (BOP).

Please see the scenario below:

* **Inventory:** 3,000 kg
* **Sales Orders (SOs):**
* SO 1: 1,000 kg (**Credit Blocked**)
* SO 2: 1,000 kg (**Credit Blocked**)
* SO 3: 1,000 kg (**Credit Blocked**)

*Note: When SOs 1 through 3 were initially created, stock was unavailable, resulting in a **zero confirmed quantity** in VA03.*

When **BOP** is executed in this state, the log shows a **Credit Warning and Saved** status for SOs 1 through 3.
However, when checking the schedule lines in **VA03**, the confirmed quantity remains zero.
In contrast, the **Product Available Stock Inquiry App (F7884)** shows 3,000 kg as **Reserved** for future requirements.

The next day, when Sales Order 4 (1,000 kg) is created, it also fails to obtain a confirmed quantity.

We would like to understand the technical reason for this behavior: why is the stock internally reserved or consumed (preventing SO 4 from obtaining it), yet the confirmed quantity remains zero in VA03?

Best Regards,
S-O

entry.title: Freight condition based on PO quantity STO (conversion)
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I have this scneario:

My PO is created based on the quantity the user wants to transfer:

In the creation of the PO, the user inputs the freight value based on the negotiation with the transporter, this condition will be accounted in the post of the delivery:

This value should not change in the course of the process. But, when we create the delivery for this STO, we have to use a conversion to move the stock:

Like I said before, the freight shouldn't change but because of this conversion in the delivery, his value it's been based on the converted field, and not in the value the user inputed:

How can I account the value inputed in the PO, don't matter the quantity of stock I'm transfering (this value change because of a analysis of the actual quantity transferred)?

This is how the FRB1 condition is maintened:

entry.title: BRAND field in Material Master
entry.content:

Best Regards,

Dinesh U

entry.title: STO BRASIL - Determinação direito fiscal ICMS
entry.content:
Olá,

preciso de ajuda com o seguinte cenário: estou realizando uma transferência com origem SP e destino SP, onde fiz a amarração do controle de cópia da minha remessa ao tipo de ordem de vendas e tipo de item ZTRF. Na J_1BSDICA, deixei o direito fiscal de ICMS vazio para esse tipo de item e o amarrei ao código de imposto I0 (com a ideia de que, uma vez vazio na J_1BSDICA, o sistema faria a sequência de acesso de MM para determinar a aba Brasil):

Em MM, determinei que o código de imposto I0 está amarrado ao IVA YS:

Desta forma, imaginei que a determinação do direito fiscal do ICMS seguiria a sequência BRLC, a qual está configurada desta maneira:

O ponto é, da forma com que imaginei a solução, uma exceção criada no grupo 15 por IVA (YS da minha transferência) e material seria relevante para determinação do direito fiscal na remessa. Porém a remessa está sendo criada com direito fiscal que está cadastrado no grupo 20:

Exceção criada no grupo 15 com IVA da transferência + material da operação:

Exceção criada no grupo 20 apenas com material:

Já rodei o programa J_1B_CBT_CONSIST e deletei registros de condições erradas. Já migrei as tabelas da J1BTAX, porém o erro persiste. Minha dúvida é: o que pode estar causando esse comportamento no sistema, de ignorar o grupo 15? Adicionalmente, se alguém tiver sugestões de como trabalhar com um único IVA na STO Brasil e resolver os impostos por exceções, estou aberto. Grato desde já!

entry.title: Customer expected price condition type EDI1
entry.content:
Hi All, I am working on the customer expected price condition type EDI1. I have created a sales order and it has normal price with PPR0 condition type. I have entered the customer expected price condition type EDI1 manually and entered some price less than the price of PPR0. system showed incomplete document due to price difference, when I save the sales order.  After this I went to Fiori app Manage Sales documents with Customer expected price and in the sales order I have clicked on Accept customer price button as shown in the below screen shot and observed that system is not replacing the actual price with expected customer price. am I missing some settings or is this standard behavior. Do we need to change the price manually.? Please guide.  

Thanks

Kumar

entry.title: Display-Only Authorization for Manage Tax Rates & Sales Prices in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
I would like to ask for your advice about authorization settings in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (SAP Grow).

For the Manage Tax Rates and Manage Sales Prices apps, is there a way to configure authorizations so that users can view the data only (Display Only) but cannot edit or create new records?

Thank you in advance.

Kindly help.

Thanks

entry.title: Create Billing for Service ID
entry.content:
Question :
During the billing process, the Service ID maintained in the service order does not appear as a billing item. Instead, the system displays the material assigned in the DIP Profile, rather than the actual Service ID from the service order.
What is the correct SAP standard configuration that allows the Service ID recorded in the service order to appear as the billing item, instead of the material derived from the DIP Profile?

Current (As-Is) Condition :
When creating a billing document for a Service Order, the item that appears in the billing document is “Material as Service”, rather than the Service ID maintained in the service order.

I have already tried entering the activity number / service ID in the “Source” field under the Set Name column, so that it would appear as the activity number / service ID during billing and quotation. However, this approach still does not work.

I forgot to mentioned that this issue also happened in quotation. process as well.

Best regards,
Ester Wang

entry.title: Sales order creation from cxml document
entry.content:
Hello,

We have one customer who is using a P2P solution which is able to send his purchase order as PO Cxml message. The objective is to create a sales document (sales order or sales quotation #S4/HANA SD#) using this cxml document.

I know we can deliver using ABAP code but I didn't find any standard way to proceed. I have even looked into SAP Business Network but resources related to sell side is not clear. 

Have I missed something ?

entry.title: How to store VA05 sales order list data into a custom Z table
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have a requirement to store the sales order list data (similar to VA05 output) into a custom Z table for reporting and reconciliation purposes.

The VA05 transaction shows a combined view of:
Sales order header data (VBAK)
Item data (VBAP)
Schedule lines (VBEP)
Business data (VBKD)
Status information (VBUK/VBUP)

My questions are:
Is it recommended to capture VA05 output directly, or should the data be read from the underlying tables (VBAK, VBAP, VBEP, VBKD, etc.)?
Is there any BAPI or standard function module that returns the complete VA05 dataset suitable for mass extraction?
What is the best-practice approach to design a Z table structure to store VA05-like data?
Header + Item in one table?
Separate header and item Z tables?
How do SAP standard programs usually handle such requirements (e.g., snapshot reporting, audit, historical reporting)?

I understand that VA05 is a reporting transaction and may use internal logic rather than a single SELECT statement.
I want to follow SAP-recommended design, especially with respect to performance and data consistency.

Any guidance or references would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Customer Master without company code info
entry.content:
Hello SAP Guru's,

I recently found a customer master where the company code section is missing all entries, except the actual company code. The business is now trying to post manual credits, which they are not able to do because of the missing reconciliation account.

I tried to extend the account with XD01 and FD01 but it keeps telling me that the account already exists.

Are there any other ways to make the necessary entries?

Thank you in advance.

Silke

entry.title: MRP with material substitution
entry.content: This is an intercompany sales scenario in which orders are placed from field locations to manufacturing plants.  The requirement is to have a way to deplete stock of the current part number but at the same time gradually allow for X amount of the new part number to be sold. They make both materials the current and the new. They want to fulfill 90% of demand with the current part number and 10% with the New part number in the first month. Then in the 2nd month they want to fulfill 80% of demand with current part number and 20% with New part number etc.

entry.title: MRP material substitution
entry.content: This is an intercompany sales scenario in which orders are placed from field locations to manufacturing plants.. The business requirement is to have a way to deplete stock of the current part number but at the same time gradually allow for X amount of the new part number to be sold. They make both materials the current and the new. They want to fulfill 90% of demand with the current PN and 10% with the New PN in the first month. Then in the 2nd month they want to fulfill 80% of demand with current PN and 20% with New PN. etc. via MRP.

entry.title: SAP ECC static credit limit not met, new order exceeds limit without block
entry.content: Scenario: Customer has credit risk set to static with a block for open orders and open deliveries. Credit risk has not been exceeded. Credit Limit is $50,000 USD.  New order is for $75,000.  New order takes the customer over the credit limit but the order does not block.  Is there a way to check the order during create, prior to saving, to see if it will cause the customer to exceed the limit?
